The joint press release by U: S. Sens. Joe Manchin, D-W.Va., and Shelley Moore Capito, R-W.Va., stating that black lung cases are at a 25-year high.
The study published by the American Jour: conducted by the National Institute for Occupational Safety and Health, which used radiographs collected from 1970 to 2017 to determine the prevalence of black lung disease.
The presence of scar tissue in the lungs: leading to difficulty in breathing, as explained by the American Lung Association.
